pr_title: Initial commit of labels priority support

timeline.message: Initial commit of labels priority support

timeline.bodyText:
This isn't needed because labels will be overridden by rtoken.getLabels().
You can remove this line and modify labels = rtoken.getLabels(); below to Map<String, String> labels = rtoken.getLabels();
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: In that case, I think it'd be nicer if parseLabelsSelectors explicitly returns a LinkedHashMap.
timeline.author: ftence
ftence
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1674,6 +1674,13 @@
    */
   public static final String WARP_LABELS_MAXSIZE = "warp.labels.maxsize";
   
+  /**
+   * Default priority order for matching labels when doing a FIND/FETCH.
+   * Comma separated list of label names.
+   * Defaults to .producer,.app,.owner
+   */
+  public static final String WARP_LABELS_PRIORITY = "warp.labels.priority";

replies.bodyText: Ditto what? This is in Configuration.java, not in an actual configuration file.
replies.author: hbs

replies.bodyText:
Sorry that was not clear.
As this conf should be moved to the warpscript conf file, the key must also start with warpscript.
replies.author: ftence

timeline.author: ftence
ftence

timeline.bodyText: In that case, I think it'd be nicer if labelSelectorsFromReadToken explicitly returns a LinkedHashMap.
timeline.author: ftence
pi-r-p

timeline.message: Fixed NPE by setting order to DEFAULT_LABELS_PRIORITY instead of null

timeline.bodyText: I think it should be Map<String,String> ordered = new LinkedHashMap<String,String>(sel.size());.
timeline.author: ftence
